message.content: This question requires an understanding of how birds navigate and seek shelter during adverse weather conditions. During a sandstorm, a bird would typically look for cover and protection from the blowing sand particles. A bush would provide a suitable refuge for a bird to seek shelter and wait out the sandstorm. Options (A), (B), and (C) are unrelated to the specific behavior of a bird during a sandstorm. A bird would not look for a worm during a sandstorm, as the sand and wind would make it difficult to find food. Looking for a mate or a stream would not be a priority for a bird during a sandstorm, as their primary focus would be on finding shelter and protecting themselves from the harsh conditions.

This question requires some basic knowledge about the behaviors of birds during sandstorms. During a sandstorm, birds typically seek shelter and protection from the harsh elements. They often look for bushes or trees to take cover under until the sandstorm subsides. Option (A) is incorrect because a bird would not be looking for worms during a sandstorm. Option (B) is also incorrect because finding a mate is not a priority during a sandstorm. Option (C) is unlikely because birds would not be searching for a stream during a sandstorm, as water sources are generally not accessible or safe during such extreme weather conditions.
